DOC.brief_summary: This randomized trial evaluate effect community-based intervention increase cervical cancer screen rate underserved Korean American woman . Due multiple factor contribute screen uptake , educational program customize Korean culture combine navigation assistance may effective increase number Korean American woman access cervical cancer screening .
DOC.brief_title: Cervical Cancer Screening Intervention Among Korean American Women
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To evaluate efficacy culturally-appropriate educational intervention compare general cancer health education program increase cervical cancer screening among Korean American woman . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To examine effect culturally-appropriate intervention woman 's knowledge , psychosocial beliefs cervical cancer screening , barrier screen compare general cancer health education program . II . To examine extent change knowledge , psychosocial belief , barrier mediate effect intervention screen behavior . OUTLINE : Participants randomize 1 2 arm . ARM I ( INTERVENTION CONDITION ) : Participants undergo culturally appropriate , church-based intervention comprise four component : 2-hour small group education session deliver church sit professional , bilingual community health educator ( CHEs ) include culturally appropriate visual aid print material Korean ; navigation assistance , include language service , appointment scheduling , transportation assistance CHEs church health worker ( CHWs ) ; referral Pap test site ; 6-month reminder letter screen . ARM II ( CONTROL CONDITION ) : Participants undergo 2-hour general health cancer education bilingual CHEs , cover nutrition , regular check-ups , tobacco use , cancer screening . Participants also receive pre-existing write material produce American Cancer Society ( ACS ) , National Institutes Health ( NIH ) , Centers Disease Control ( CDC ) . , advise seek regular preventive health service . After completion study , participant follow post-intervention 12 month .
DOC.criteria: Selfidentified Korean ethnicity Possessing functional telephone home person Anticipated presence geographic region period one year A current diagnosis cervical cancer Have Pap test within past 12 month Are currently adherent doctor recommend screening interval
